title: Invisible Backdoor Attack Through Singular Value Decomposition
abstract: arXiv:2403.13018v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: With the widespread application of deep learning across various domains, concerns about its security have grown significantly. Among these, backdoor attacks pose a serious security threat to deep neural networks (DNNs). In recent years, backdoor attacks on neural networks have become increasingly sophisticated, aiming to compromise the security and trustworthiness of models by implanting hidden, unauthorized functionalities or triggers, leading to misleading predictions or behaviors. To make triggers less perceptible and imperceptible, various invisible backdoor attacks have been proposed. translated_title: 通过奇异值分解实现的隐形后门攻击
translated_abstract: 随着深度学习在各个领域的广泛应用，对其安全性的关注也显著增加。在其中，后门攻击对深度神经网络（DNNs）构成严重安全威胁。近年来，对神经网络的后门攻击变得越来越复杂，旨在通过植入隐藏的未授权功能或触发器来破坏模型的安全性和可信度，从而导致误导性的预测或行为。为了使触发器不易察觉甚至是隐形的，提出了各种隐形后门攻击。然而，大多数仅考虑了空间域中的不可见性，使得最近的防御方法很容易检测到生成的有毒图像。为了解决这些挑战，本文提出了一种称为DEBA的隐形后门攻击。DEBA利用奇异值分解（SVD）的数学属性嵌入了不可察觉的后门。
tldr: 通过奇异值分解实现了一种隐形后门攻击，以解决现有防御方法对于生成有毒图像的检测问题。
en_tdlr: The paper presents an invisible backdoor attack using Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) to address the challenge of detection of toxic images by recent defense methods.
